Problem:
Consider a system described by the complex function \\(z(t) = e^{i\omega t}\\), where \\( \omega \\) is a constant frequency. The impact of an integral transformation defined by \\( T(z) = \int_0^t e^{i\omega s}z(s) ds \\) is analyzed over time t.

If \\( T(z) \\) is applied to the function starting at t = 0 and then allowed to evolve under its own dynamics without further intervention, will the functional form of \\( z(T) \\) at t = T be the same as if \\( z(t) \\) was directly evolved to t = T without transformation?
Explanation: The transformation \\( T(z) \\) accumulates the effects of the exponential function over time, altering the path of \\( z(t) \\) due to the integral, thus leading to a different outcome at time T compared to an unmodified evolution.
